item.name: Real-time Pricing Engine
item.description: fabricâ€™s Real-time Pricing Engine (RTPE) endpoints are used to calculate prices and evaluate discounts for individual products and carts.

item.name: Calculate prices for products by IDs

request.name: Calculate prices for products by IDs

description.content: Use this endpoint to calculate prices for one or more products in a specific price list by product IDs. Note that the `itemId` is used as the default identifier for a product. If you want to set SKUs as product identifiers, you must contact fabric support at support@fabric.inc.
Date and time, in ISO 8601 format, for which the evaluation should be done. The prices and promotions that are active on this date will be considered for evaluation.

response.name: OK

description.content: Date and time, in ISO 8601 format, for which the evaluation should be done. The prices and promotions that are active on this date will be considered for evaluation.
Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

response.name: Partially succeeded in getting results for each item. Check status in the retrieved objects.

description.content: Date and time, in ISO 8601 format, for which the evaluation should be done. The prices and promotions that are active on this date will be considered for evaluation.
Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

item.name: Calculate prices for products by SKUs

request.name: Calculate prices for products by SKUs

description.content: Use this endpoint to calculate prices for one or more products in a specific price list by product SKUs. Note that the `itemId` is used as the default identifier for a product. If you want to set SKUs as product identifiers, you must contact fabric support at support@fabric.inc.
Date and time, in ISO 8601 format, for which the evaluation should be done. The prices and promotions that are active on this date will be considered for evaluation.

response.name: OK

description.content: Date and time, in ISO 8601 format, for which the evaluation should be done. The prices and promotions that are active on this date will be considered for evaluation.
Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

response.name: Partially succeeded in getting results for each item.

Evaluate cart's total cost instantly, after applying all applicable promotions and discount coupons. Using this endpoint, submit a range of data that will be referenced against the conditions that are set earlier using the promotions, coupons or prices APIs. The response includes the details of the promotions and discounts applied. These promotions and discounts can be displayed on your website to help shoppers know that they are getting their expected discounts.
Date and time, in ISO 8601 format, for which the evaluation should be done. The prices and promotions that are active on this date will be considered for evaluation.

response.name: OK

description.content: Date and time, in ISO 8601 format, for which the evaluation should be done. The prices and promotions that are active on this date will be considered for evaluation.
Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

item.name: Promotions
item.description:
Promotions are discounts on items, cart or shipping method. These endpoints let you create and manage promotional discounts that are applied to the customers' carts that meet the required conditions.
**Note:** Because promotions are linked to specific price lists, you must submit the correct price list ID.

description.content: Get a paginated list of all promotions.
Number of records to be returned on a single page
Record from which searching of records starts

Field by which you want to sort promotions. Format is {sort order}{field name}:
- descending order
+ ascending order
Platform where the request is made
Number of records to be returned on a single page
Record from which searching of records starts

Field by which you want to sort promotions. Format is {sort order}{field name}:
- descending order
+ ascending order

Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

- descending order
+ ascending order

This endpoint lets you change promotion status by enabling or disabling a promotion, not applicable to *ACTIVE* promotions.
**Enable a promotion:** Only *disabled* promotions can be enabled.
**Disable a promotion:** Only *not expired* promotions can be disabled.
(Required) Promotion ID to toggle the promotion

item.name: Coupons
item.description: Coupons are codes that shoppers can enter during checkout to receive discounts. These endpoints let merchants create and manage such codes. Coupons can be applied under the conditions set up by the merchant.

item.name: Product Exclusion Lists
item.description: Product exclusion lists let you protect SKUs from being discounted by active promotions. These endpoints let you create and manage such product exclusion lists.

description.content: Get a paginated list of product exclusion lists based on the query parameters.
Number of records to be returned on a single page
Record from which searching of records starts
The number of initial records to skip. For example, if the offset is set to 20 and the limit is 10, the records from 21 to 30 are returned.
Type of the product exclusion list to filter records
Scope of the product exclusion list to filter records. It is used to identify whether to exclude discounts on the SKU price or associated shipping price.
Date that lies between `startAt` and `endAt` of product exclusion list
Platform where the request is made
Number of records to be returned on a single page

Get a paginated list of price details for the given `itemId` and `priceListId`. If `priceListId` is not specified, prices are retrieved for the `itemId` that belongs to the default price list.
Number of records to be returned on a single page
Record from which searching of records starts
Price list ID to which the item belongs. If not sent, the default price list is considered.

Status to filter prices
**ACTIVE** displays current prices or regular prices. These are the prices that are actively displayed and are applied to products on an ongoing basis.
**SCHEDULED** displays prices that will be applied to products in future. Retailers often use scheduled prices as part of their marketing campaigns to attract customers, generate sales, clear inventory, or create a sense of urgency.
**ALL** displays both ACTIVE and SCHEDULED prices.
(Required) Item ID for which prices are retrieved
Platform where the request is made
Number of records to be returned on a single page
Record from which searching of records starts

**SCHEDULED** displays prices that will be applied to products in future. Retailers often use scheduled prices as part of their marketing campaigns to attract customers, generate sales, clear inventory, or create a sense of urgency.
**ALL** displays both ACTIVE and SCHEDULED prices.

**SCHEDULED** displays prices that will be applied to products in future. Retailers often use scheduled prices as part of their marketing campaigns to attract customers, generate sales, clear inventory, or create a sense of urgency.
**ALL** displays both ACTIVE and SCHEDULED prices.
Platform where the request is made

item.name: Segments
item.description: Segmentation is a way of grouping customers who share similar characteristics. They may be grouped in a number of ways such as, age group, demographics, location, device type, and so on. After creating a segment of customers, you can target promotions to a specific customer segment by linking the promotion to a segment identifier.

item.name: Price Lists
item.description: Price list is a collection of items and their assigned prices. An item can exist in multiple price lists. This gives you the ability to assign different prices to the same item. Price lists let you set the currency and duration of the prices. For example, if the price list expires, prices of items within the price list will also expire.

description.content: Get a paginated list of all price lists.
Number of records to be returned on a single page
Record from which searching of records starts
The number of initial records to skip. For example, if the offset is set to 20 and the limit is 10, the records from 21 to 30 are returned.

Field to sort the price lists. Format is {sort order}{field name}:
- descending order
+ ascending order

Status by which records are filtered.
ACTIVE: Active price lists are those whose `endAt` date is in future than the `startAt` date.

true: Returns details of the default price list.
false: Returns all price lists.

item.name: Price Controls
item.description: Price controls let you create and manage more diversified prices for the item, such as Manufacturer Recommended Retail Price (MSRP), Minimum Advertised Price (MAP), floor price, ceiling price, sale price, and so on other than the regular price types supported by fabric Offers. Price control works as a protection mechanism against any further creation of prices for the item.

description.content: Create a price control record that contains various price types other than the elemental prices such as base price, sale price, and sale price.

fabric Offers is a holistic e-commerce solution enabling Merchants to execute a range of pricing strategies to increase their competitiveness in the market and set the right promotion, to the right customer through the most effective channel. Offers is a cornerstone capability that can be sold as part of the integrated suite or stand on its own as an industry leading Pricing and Promotion system for B2B and B2C. The controls and automation provided will drastically reduce operational overhead and ensure merchants can quickly react to their fast-changing environment.

fabric e-commerce Offers endpoints allow you to to set up and manage stock keeping unit (SKU) prices. Its wide range of coupon and promotion features let you design deals ranging from single-use, customer-specific coupons to site-wide promotions.
